text: you walk in you're thinking about great
dry-aged beef as soon as you walk in
here I call it a sweet funk it's got a
certain edge to it but it's it's
wonderful and this is what you smell is
what you tasted a great piece of dry
aged beef smells like money in here my
name is Mark Saracen and I'm George
Faison we're here at de Braga Smith Lord
meat purveyors in Jersey City New Jersey
dry aged beef is a process whereby we
actually remove moisture from the
product and more importantly we allow
the product to tenderize over a period
of time being anywhere from 21 to 45
even 60 to 90 days depending on the
client of the product and dry aging is
almost a misnomer because we're not
looking to dry the meat out like you
would say a prosciutto or a piece of
beef jerky
on the contrary we want it to be a slow
evolution so that the flavors develop
yeah it loses some humidity but what
really happens is that the flavor
transforms like say a great cheese would
they were a great bottle of wine in this
dry aged cooler what
what you're seeing is meat that is dry
aging it is in a pristine environment
that's held at about 34 35 degrees you
really want to encourage the meat to
shrink to actually in a way dehydrate to
get a little smaller to lose body weight
meat will lose anywhere from 10 to 15
percent of its original weight when it
finishes a process in our aging room I'm
a second-generation owner but I can tell
you that what we do is very artisanal in
nature
my grandfather was a shark Pookie my
father was a butcher by trade so for me
it's it's family born and bred and I
could think of nothing better than when
I walk to my shop and I see our guys
with knives and cutting and using skills
that you really don't see that much
anymore today that's like the greatest
feeling in the world to me it really is
